image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Donald Trump taps Jacob Helberg as under secretary of state for economic growth, energy, and environment
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has appointed Jacob Helberg as Under Secretary of State for Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment. Helberg, a senior advisor at Palantir and a China hawk, will focus on advancing American economic interests and technological dominance abroad, reflecting Trump's 'America First' foreign policy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Syria Kurdish-led force announces US-brokered truce with Turkish-backed fighters in Manbij
Elon Musk and Donald Trump Jr react to meme comparing Zelenskyy to ‘Home Alone’ character
item.description: Elon Musk and Donald Trump Jr. reacted to a meme comparing Ukrainian President Zelensky to Kevin McAllister from Home Alone 2. The meme shows Zelensky, edited to wear Kevin's hat, asking Trump for directions in a scene from the movie.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US man leaps over bench to attack judge in viral video, gets decades in prison
item.description: A Las Vegas man received a lengthy prison sentence for attacking a judge. Deobra Redden pleaded guilty to attempted murder. He jumped over the judge's bench and assaulted her. The courtroom video captured the entire incident. Redden will be eligible for parole after 2050. The judge, Mary Kay Holthus, thankfully survived the attack.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO killer Luigi Mangione's X account, once suspended, now verified
item.description: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old former Ivy League student, was arrested for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Mangione's reinstated X account, now verified, has gained a large following. He was found with a gun, silencer, fake IDs, and a manifesto, reportedly fueled by resentment towards the US healthcare system. Mangione's LinkedIn profile indicates he works as a data engineer.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Luigi Mangione’s mugshot sparks internet frenzy: Netizens dub him ‘hot assassin’
item.description: Luigi Mangione, 26, arrested in connection with the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, has become an unlikely internet sensation. His mugshot has gone viral, sparking memes, fan-made merchandise, and a surge in followers on his previously dormant Instagram account.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Assad's fall exposes grim secrets of dungeons, 'human slaughterhouse' in Syria
item.description: Following the fall of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, hidden dungeons and torture chambers within Damascus's security compound were revealed. Former detainees recounted horrific experiences, including arbitrary arrests, torture, and dire conditions. Families desperately searched for missing loved ones, while unearthed documents exposed the extensive surveillance of Syrian citizens, even cabinet ministers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Malibu wildfire sweeps through California: Homes destroyed, thousands evacuated, including celebrities
item.description: Malibu wildfire sweeps through California: Homes destroyed, thousands evacuated, including celebrities

item.title: Who is Thomas M Dickey? Defense attorney representing Luigi Mangione in high-profile murder case
Who is Mohammad al-Bashir, Syria's caretaker prime minister?
item.description: Mohammad al-Bashir, a former "Salvation Government" leader in Idlib, Syria, is now the nation's head. The engineering graduate takes the helm after a 13-year conflict, governing from Damascus. Bashir, originally from Idlib, previously worked for Syria's state gas company and led the rebel administration. His leadership expands beyond Idlib after a recent rebel offensive captured key territories, including Aleppo.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Zero evidence': What UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's alleged shooter Luigi Mangione's lawyer said
item.description: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old Ivy League graduate, was arrested for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Mangione's lawyer insists on his client's innocence, citing a lack of evidence. Mangione, found with a "ghost gun" and manifesto criticizing the healthcare system, is fighting extradition from Pennsylvania to New York.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UnitedHealth Group CEO murder: Luigi Mangione's arrest still leaves key questions unanswered
item.description: Luigi Mangione, apprehended in Pennsylvania, faces extradition to New York for the murder of UnitedHealth executive Brian Thompson. Mangione, found with a homemade gun, cash, and a manifesto criticizing the healthcare industry, is fighting extradition. His manifesto details his anger towards healthcare costs, while recovered shell casings hint at further clues.

item.title: US visa bulletin brings key progress for Indian green card seekers in January 2025
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Stop genocide': Canadian Hindus stage protest outside Bangladesh consulate in Toronto
item.description: Canadian Hindus protested in Toronto against the persecution of minorities in Bangladesh. They highlighted violence, destruction of religious sites, and the recent arrest of a Hindu priest. Protesters urged the international community to pressure Bangladesh to protect minority rights and ensure peace.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: The $60k question: Who’s getting rewarded for catching Mangione, and when?
item.description: Luigi Mangione, suspected of killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, was apprehended in a Pennsylvania McDonald's after a customer tip. A $60,000 reward is available, but claiming it won't be easy. The FBI and NYPD Crime Stoppers have different criteria, requiring conviction and indictment, respectively.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Air, naval, ground strikes: Video shows Israel's massive operation in Syria days after Assad ouster
item.description: Following the ousting of President Assad, Israel launched extensive airstrikes across Syria, targeting over 350 military sites. The IDF claims the operation neutralized threats and prevented weapons from reaching extremist groups. While Israel denies advancing on Damascus, opposition sources report troops nearing the capital. International condemnation followed, with concerns over Israel's territorial ambitions and violation of the 1974 disengagement agreement.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China warns against Taiwan 'separatist' activity: All you need to know
item.description: China's military conducted extensive air and naval activities near Taiwan, prompting the island's defense ministry to activate an emergency response center. Taiwanese officials described the activities as training, while China reiterated its stance against Taiwanese independence and foreign collaboration. The increased military presence followed Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te's recent visits to Hawaii and Guam.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'People in tears': Cars set ablaze, buildings sprayed with anti-Israel graffiti in Australia
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Drunk driver takes SUV on joyride on New York's railway tracks, ends in fiery blaze
item.description: A drunk driver in Brooklyn drove his SUV onto LIRR tracks near Elmont-UBS Arena station, causing a fire and service disruptions on Sunday. The vehicle was removed after three hours, and the driver was arrested and charged with reckless endangerment, trespassing, and DWI. No injuries were reported, but commuters experienced significant delays.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Like 2 different people': Ex-roommate of UnitedHealthcare CEO's killer Luigi Mangione speaks out
